Riot has had to buff Bard since his release, he's a support with almost self counterplay and probably the highest skillcap support in the game to even be halfway decent with him he needs a rework, bug fixes, and probably more buffs on top of that. In reality they should've made him into a support jungler with his passive and mechanics but Riot has this problem with theme vs practical role.

Uhhhhhhh 
1) what self counterplay?
2) rework? What?
3) bug fixes? The only bug I have is when you get knocked up super high when you go to go into a tunnel
4) buffs? No. The 7.7 buffs are already op, you just don't know how to play bard
Bard is arguably the most fun and satisfying support in the game.

1. His ult pretty much can kill his teammates, his heal shrines can be stomped and they exist in the first place making enemies aware of where low health teammates are going to go, his q can just not stun or hit targets correctly, his e can put your team in a bad spot or the enemy team in a better one.
2. With Bard's theme of a roamer, that style would better suit a jungler(he can't clear) or a mid(not enough damage in kit) champ, not a bot lane support pretty much we get reported if we're not babysitting the adc 95% of the game.
3. Bard has so many bugs with his e. There's no indicator where the **actually** exit ends, sometimes the portal is off where your cursor directs it to so it goes in the wrong direction ends at the wrong point and can sometimes just spit you at the side of the wall, and his q will have wonkey miss fortune style interactions where it doesn't hit in an intended line or to directed targets it can go all wanted style and curve 30 degrees to hit a target off to the side. If you guys doubt me just spend 10 mins in practice tool and you'll see every instance of what I'm talking about.
4. Look I've owned bard since his release, he was freaking released on  my birthday lol, in essence he's what Kayle support should've functioned as but he falls flat as a **dependable** support because his abilities affect his team as much as they do the enemy. 

I'm not saying buffs are bad for Bard, I'm just saying they have had to buff him extensively to make up for qol issues he's had since release. Give us an auto ping like Ryze and Panth ults to give teammates a better heads up, make our portal outhole the same size as the inhole so it's more clear where we get spit out and allow bard and team to go through the portal by clicking on it and not through it, do something with his e so it gets a reduced cooldown on getting chimes so you can get back to lane quicker.
Man I'm sorry but everything you said there, if you're experienced with bard, is just wrong. Except the part about e bugs. I can easily play Bard in top/mid/jg, and have before.

Vlad just got a much needed auto attack buff recently... He's not forgotten at all.

It did nothing for his game health or viability. This meta right now is to end the game as early as possible. Vlad can't do that, like, at all.

People think he's viable because of his W, which is on such a high cooldown, that it's essentially a shittier version of Fizz's E; His passive, which helps him sustain, but is only really good in late; and his ult, which is absolute bullshit, A % Damage Amp AoE that heals Vlad after it's done is broken.

But one broken ability does not a good champion make, especially when it's an ult that relies on teammates.

TL;DR: Vlad is too late game centric to be viable right now, just because an LCS player did it, doesn't mean it's good. It just means that THEY were good.
Have you seen the video of vlad 1v3ing? He sustains incredibly well.

Just because he can sustain doesn't mean he's good. That sustain doesn't mean shit if the enemy knows how to build against Vlad. You have to build health and AP, tank is worthless.

Grevious Wounds and Lethality basically shut him down. He's only crazy good in late game, but you can get shut down so easily all game long. He's just not good in the current meta.
